name: Tooltip with Border + Magic Tail
description:
Features

  • Auto Layout that works with a border around the whole tooltip
  • Dark mode, rounded, & angular Variants
  • 12 preset tail positions
  • Tail position freely adjustable to any pixel position (inspired by Chudo Loo’s Resizable Auto Layout Spacer)


Tooltips with tails, borders, and Auto Layout are not straightforward to create, because you can’t put a single continuous stroke around multiple non-rectangular layers nested in Auto Layout. Simpler hacks are not possible because Auto Layout forces a layer z-index order. So I made this.


Usage tips

To adjust the position of the Tail, adjust the padding of the Tail Position layer. For up and down-pointing tooltips, adjust left/right padding. For left and right-pointing tooltips, adjust top/bottom padding.


You can play with the width of Tail Anchor to adjust the Tail’s minimum distance from the corners.


To edit the main frame’s padding of all the Variants at the same time, select the top-level component frame and press Return.


How this tooltip is built

  1. The Tail is 2 vector shapes so that it can have a fill and part of a border.
  2. The Tail is offset to be outside a Tail Anchor to make it look like it’s part of the main frame.
  3. Using a 0.01px layer size hack enables Tail Anchor to take up 0px of space.
  4. Tail Anchor is nested in Tail Position, which has Auto Layout applied so that its padding controls Tail Anchor’s position.
  5. Tail Position is nested in the main frame, ensuring that it’s always on top of the main frame’s stroke.
  6. The main frame has Auto Layout applied to ensure the text controls the tooltip size.
